CartConvert.cpp

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**
00002  * \file CartConvert.cpp
00003  * \brief Command line utility for geodetic to cartesian coordinate conversions
00004  *
00005  * Copyright (c) Charles Karney (2009, 2010, 2011) <charles@karney.com>
00006  * and licensed under the LGPL.  For more information, see
00007  * http://geographiclib.sourceforge.net/
00008  *
00009  * Compile with -I../include and link with Geocentric.o LocalCartesian.o
00010  *
00011  * See the <a href="CartConvert.1.html">man page</a> for usage
00012  * information.
00013  **********************************************************************/
00014 
00015 #include <iostream>
00016 #include <sstream>
00017 #include <string>
00018 #include <sstream>
00019 #include <fstream>
00020 #include <GeographicLib/Geocentric.hpp>
00021 #include <GeographicLib/LocalCartesian.hpp>
00022 #include <GeographicLib/DMS.hpp>
00023 
00024 #include "CartConvert.usage"
00025 
00026 int main(int argc, char* argv[]) {
00027   try {
00028     using namespace GeographicLib;
00029     typedef Math::real real;
00030     bool localcartesian = false, reverse = false;
00031     real
00032       a = Constants::WGS84_a<real>(),
00033       r = Constants::WGS84_r<real>();
00034     real lat0 = 0, lon0 = 0, h0 = 0;
00035     std::string istring, ifile, ofile;
00036 
00037     for (int m = 1; m < argc; ++m) {
00038       std::string arg(argv[m]);
00039       if (arg == "-r")
00040         reverse = true;
00041       else if (arg == "-l") {
00042         localcartesian = true;
00043         if (m + 3 >= argc) return usage(1, true);
00044         try {
00045           DMS::DecodeLatLon(std::string(argv[m + 1]), std::string(argv[m + 2]),
00046                             lat0, lon0);
00047           h0 = DMS::Decode(std::string(argv[m + 3]));
00048         }
00049         catch (const std::exception& e) {
00050           std::cerr << "Error decoding arguments of -l: " << e.what() << "\n";
00051           return 1;
00052         }
00053         m += 3;
00054       } else if (arg == "-e") {
00055         if (m + 2 >= argc) return usage(1, true);
00056         try {
00057           a = DMS::Decode(std::string(argv[m + 1]));
00058           r = DMS::Decode(std::string(argv[m + 2]));
00059         }
00060         catch (const std::exception& e) {
00061           std::cerr << "Error decoding arguments of -e: " << e.what() << "\n";
00062           return 1;
00063         }
00064         m += 2;
00065       } else if (arg == "--input-string") {
00066         if (++m == argc) return usage(1, true);
00067         istring = argv[m];
00068       } else if (arg == "--input-file") {
00069         if (++m == argc) return usage(1, true);
00070         ifile = argv[m];
00071       } else if (arg == "--output-file") {
00072         if (++m == argc) return usage(1, true);
00073         ofile = argv[m];
00074       } else if (arg == "--version") {
00075         std::cout
00076           << argv[0]
00077           << ": $Id: 0f97d34be752abc4abfa9f3e48c1424c4175460e $\n"
00078           << "GeographicLib version " << GEOGRAPHICLIB_VERSION_STRING << "\n";
00079         return 0;
00080       } else
00081         return usage(!(arg == "-h" || arg == "--help"), arg != "--help");
00082     }
00083 
00084     if (!ifile.empty() && !istring.empty()) {
00085       std::cerr << "Cannot specify --input-string and --input-file together\n";
00086       return 1;
00087     }
00088     if (ifile == "-") ifile.clear();
00089     std::ifstream infile;
00090     std::istringstream instring;
00091     if (!ifile.empty()) {
00092       infile.open(ifile.c_str());
00093       if (!infile.is_open()) {
00094         std::cerr << "Cannot open " << ifile << " for reading\n";
00095         return 1;
00096       }
00097     } else if (!istring.empty()) {
00098       std::string::size_type m = 0;
00099       while (true) {
00100         m = istring.find(';', m);
00101         if (m == std::string::npos)
00102           break;
00103         istring[m] = '\n';
00104       }
00105       instring.str(istring);
00106     }
00107     std::istream* input = !ifile.empty() ? &infile :
00108       (!istring.empty() ? &instring : &std::cin);
00109 
00110     std::ofstream outfile;
00111     if (ofile == "-") ofile.clear();
00112     if (!ofile.empty()) {
00113       outfile.open(ofile.c_str());
00114       if (!outfile.is_open()) {
00115         std::cerr << "Cannot open " << ofile << " for wrting\n";
00116         return 1;
00117       }
00118     }
00119     std::ostream* output = !ofile.empty() ? &outfile : &std::cout;
00120 
00121     const Geocentric ec(a, r);
00122     const LocalCartesian lc(lat0, lon0, h0, ec);
00123 
00124     std::string s;
00125     int retval = 0;
00126     while (std::getline(*input, s)) {
00127       try {
00128         std::istringstream str(s);
00129         real lat, lon, h, x, y, z;
00130         std::string stra, strb, strc;
00131         if (!(str >> stra >> strb >> strc))
00132           throw  GeographicErr("Incomplete input: " + s);
00133         if (reverse) {
00134           x = DMS::Decode(stra);
00135           y = DMS::Decode(strb);
00136           z = DMS::Decode(strc);
00137         } else {
00138           DMS::DecodeLatLon(stra, strb, lat, lon);
00139           h = DMS::Decode(strc);
00140         }
00141         std::string strd;
00142         if (str >> strd)
00143           throw GeographicErr("Extraneous input: " + strd);
00144         if (reverse) {
00145           if (localcartesian)
00146             lc.Reverse(x, y, z, lat, lon, h);
00147           else
00148             ec.Reverse(x, y, z, lat, lon, h);
00149           *output << DMS::Encode(lat, 15, DMS::NUMBER) << " "
00150                   << DMS::Encode(lon, 15, DMS::NUMBER) << " "
00151                   << DMS::Encode(h, 12, DMS::NUMBER) << "\n";
00152         } else {
00153           if (localcartesian)
00154             lc.Forward(lat, lon, h, x, y, z);
00155           else
00156             ec.Forward(lat, lon, h, x, y, z);
00157           *output << DMS::Encode(x, 10, DMS::NUMBER) << " "
00158                   << DMS::Encode(y, 10, DMS::NUMBER) << " "
00159                   << DMS::Encode(z, 10, DMS::NUMBER) << "\n";
00160         }
00161       }
00162       catch (const std::exception& e) {
00163         *output << "ERROR: " << e.what() << "\n";
00164         retval = 1;
00165       }
00166     }
00167     return retval;
00168   }
00169   catch (const std::exception& e) {
00170     std::cerr << "Caught exception: " << e.what() << "\n";
00171     return 1;
00172   }
00173   catch (...) {
00174     std::cerr << "Caught unknown exception\n";
00175     return 1;
00176   }
00177 }
